containerDefinitions.name: init-container-for-secret-files
command: for secret in ${SECRET_FILES//,/ }; do echo "Fetching $secret..."; echo "Debug: AWS_REGION=$AWS_REGION, SECRET_PATH=/etc/secrets"; # First try to get as SecretString (for text secrets)SECRET_VALUE=$(aws secretsmanager get-secret-value --secret-id $secret --region $AWS_REGION --query SecretString --output text 2>/dev/null); STRING_RESULT=$?; if [ $STRING_RESULT -eq 0 ] && [ -n "$SECRET_VALUE" ] && [ "$SECRET_VALUE" != "null" ] && [ "$SECRET_VALUE" != "none" ] && [ "$SECRET_VALUE" != "None" ]; then echo "Found text secret, saving to /etc/secrets/$secret"; echo "$SECRET_VALUE" > /etc/secrets/$secret; else echo "Text retrieval failed or returned null, trying binary retrieval..."; # Try to get as SecretBinary (for binary secrets like certificates/keys)aws secretsmanager get-secret-value --secret-id $secret --region $AWS_REGION --query SecretBinary --output text | base64 -d > /etc/secrets/$secret 2>/dev/null; BINARY_RESULT=$?; if [ $BINARY_RESULT -eq 0 ] && [ -s {secrets_files_path}/$secret ]; then echo "Found binary secret, saved to /etc/secrets/$secret"; else echo "❌ Failed to retrieve $secret as either text or binary" >&2; echo "Text result: $STRING_RESULT, Binary result: $BINARY_RESULT" >&2; exit 1; fi; fi; echo "✅ Successfully saved $secret to /etc/secrets/$secret (size: $(stat -c%s /etc/secrets/$secret 2>/dev/null || wc -c < /etc/secrets/$secret))"; done
